Hippuric acid

Hippuric acid is a metabolite of toluene, and causes a metabolic acidosis in glue sniffers. It is freely filtered and efficiently secreted by the kidney, so that all of the hippuric acid that enters the kidney in the blood, leaves it in the urine. Therefore hippuric acid clearance = renal plasma flow. (Multiply by 1/(1-haematocrit) to get renal blood flow.) Because hippurate ions are so rapidly cleared from plasma, the anion gap is normal, even though the acidosis is caused by an exogenous weak acid.
